message: hello everybody .. this convore thing is new to me so forgive me any errors or stuff like that ;]

i was wondering how i can get buildout ot use gmake instead of make as im trying to build typhoonAE on FreeBSD. One of the dependancies is libmemcached which needs gmake instead of make and i have no clue how to change the buildout.cfg so that the recipe uses gmake ;]
i set an environment variable MAKE to /usr/bin/gmake or whereever it is.
and ofcourse the zc.recipe.cmmi is a zipped egg, not a dir so no easy hacking ;[

this works to set the make used by configure to use gmake .. unfortunately the cmmi recipe calls system("make") which still calls the "normal" make. lets see if i can configure the cmmi stuff ;] thnx !
freebsd is a charm isn't it?
good luck, I just got lxml libs installed after days.
hehe yeah ;] i normally use ubuntu but this is a freebsd jail almost for free so i need to use what i've been provided with.
@jsonbot I have unzip=true in .buildout/default.cfg to prevent the zipped egg annoyance.
thnx for the tip ;] seems a bit unpossible to use the standaard TyphoonAE buildout.cfg so i am trying now to make my own buildout.cfg and use the ports to compile as much as possible
